Package de.unistuttgart.iste.rss.oo.hamstersimulator.external.model

Class HamsterGame

java.lang.Object
de.unistuttgart.iste.rss.oo.hamstersimulator.external.model.HamsterGame
public class HamsterGame
extends Object
A class representing an instance of a hamster game. A hamster game consists of a territory, on which the game takes place, a game log for messages, and a command stack for keeping track of the game's history.
Author:
Steffen Becker

  • Constructor Details

    • HamsterGame

      public HamsterGame()
      Initialize a hamster game. The hamster game is in mode Initialized in the beginning and needs to have its territory defined or loaded and the game started to be useful. The default constructor initializes the hamster game with a dummy IO interface, i.e., reading values is not allowed and exceptions from the hamster game will be rethrown.

    • HamsterGame

      public HamsterGame​(InputInterface newInputInterface)
      Initialize a hamster game. The hamster game is in mode Initialized in the beginning and needs to have its territory defined or loaded and the game started to be useful. This constructor initializes the hamster game with the given object to handle read commands of the hamster (e.g., from a GUI or from Mockups) and to handle any exception thrown from the user defined hamster game.
      Parameters:
      newInputInterface - The input interface this game should use for reading values from the user and to handle exceptions.

  • Method Details

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(double gameSpeed)
      Set the speed of the delay of the hamster game. The closer the delay is to 0, the faster the hamster game will run.
      Parameters:
      gameSpeed - The new game speed's delay. Has to be greater 0.

    • getTerritory

      public Territory getTerritory()
      Getter for the territory object of this game. Cannot be null.
      Returns:
      The territory object of this game.

    • getGameLog

      public GameLog getGameLog()
      Getter for the game log. Cannot be null.
      Returns:
      The game log of this hamster game's instance.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initialize a new hamster game by loading the default territory.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(TerritoryBuilder territoryBuilder)
      Initialize a new hamster game by loading the default territory.
      Parameters:
      territoryBuilder - A territory builder which has been used before to build the territory.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(String territoryFile) throws IOException
      Initialize a new hamster game by loading the territory from the passed territory file path.
      Parameters:
      territoryFile - The territory file path. Has to be a location relative to the classes' class path.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException occurs if the territory file could not be found or loaded.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException
      Initialize a new hamster game by loading the territory from the passed territory file path.
      Parameters:
      inputStream - The input stream to load the territory from.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException occurs if the territory file could not be found or loaded.

    • getNewTerritoryBuilder

      public TerritoryBuilder getNewTerritoryBuilder()
      Return a territory builder for this game's terriotry. The builder can be passed to an initialize call later to use the created territory.
      Returns:
      A territory builder for this territory

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset the hamster game to its initial state. Removes all hamsters besides the default hamster and places all gain objects to their initial position.

    • getInputInterface

      public InputInterface getInputInterface()
      Gets the input interface of this game used to read values from users or mock objects.
      Returns:
      The input interface for this game.

    • setInputInterface

      public void setInputInterface​(InputInterface newInputInterface)
      Sets this game's input interface for reading values from users or mock objects.
      Parameters:
      newInputInterface - The new input interface.

    • displayInNewGameWindow

      public void displayInNewGameWindow()
      Opens a new Game UI for this game object. The game UI shows the game and its current state while the game is executing.

    • runGame

      public void runGame​(Consumer<Territory> hamsterProgram)
      Run a given hamster program until it terminates. Termination is either by ending the hamster game regularly or by throwing an exception and not handling it inside the provided hamster program. The game will be started automatically if it had not been started before. The game will be in paused mode, suitable for GUI runs, if it is started by this method. After returning from this method the game will be in stopped state no matter whether an exception was thrown or the program terminated regularly. Precondition to running the game is that the territory has been defined or loaded and that an IO interface is attached for reading values and handling exceptions.
      Parameters:
      hamsterProgram - The hamster program to run.

    • startGame

      public void startGame​(boolean startPaused)
      Start the execution of a hamster game. Before executing start, no commands can be executed by the hamster objects in the game.
      Parameters:
      startPaused - if true the game will be started in pause mode

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame()
      Stop the execution of the game. The game is finished and needs to be reseted or closed.

    • getCurrentGameMode

      public GameCommandStack.Mode getCurrentGameMode()
      Get the current state of this game.
      Returns:
      The current state of this game.
